Posted By: azure_drake222222 (2/3/2013 3:11:12 PM)

posts.post_content:
**Each *Time Spiral* card was an homage to at least one previously printed card.**  
Specifically, **each Sliver in *Time Spiral* and *Planar Chaos* derive their ability from a previously printed card.**  
  
This Sliver is referencing a previous sliver, [Metallic Sliver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Metallic Sliver), only larger. The Venser referenced here is [Venser, Shaper Savant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Venser, Shaper Savant), a powerful artificer who, like [Volrath the Fallen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Volrath the Fallen) before him, was attempting to use an artificial sliver to study the way the sliver hive mentality worked. During the events of *Time Spiral* block, his planeswalker spark ignited; he would later appear as [Venser, the Sojourner](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Venser, the Sojourner).
posts.html:
Each Time Spiral card was an homage to at least one previously printed card.
Specifically, each Sliver in Time Spiral and Planar Chaos derive their ability from a previously printed card.

This Sliver is referencing a previous sliver, Metallic Sliver, only larger. The Venser referenced here is Venser, Shaper Savant, a powerful artificer who, like Volrath the Fallen before him, was attempting to use an artificial sliver to study the way the sliver hive mentality worked. During the events of Time Spiral block, his planeswalker spark ignited; he would later appear as Venser, the Sojourner.

Posted By: Missile_Penguin (12/2/2012 2:19:12 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
He's the thing about Venser's Sliver: It doesn't benefit other slivers. Now, why might that be relevant?  
  
Think about it for a sec. When would you not want to benefit other slivers?  
  
Got it yet? When you're going against a Sliver deck. Venser's Sliver is a 3/3 Sliver which does nothing to other slivers and can be put in any other sliver deck. While I certainly agree he'd be fine at ![4](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=4&type=symbol), or as a 4/4, he's not a one star critter people. [Chimney Imp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Chimney Imp) is a one star creature.

posts.post_content:
@Richard\_Hawk...I know I probably shouldn't...but I've been waiting for an excuse to run this design by some people, so here goes:  
  
Urza's Sliver 0  
Mythic Rare  
Artifact Creature- Sliver Ally  
Slivers you control have:  
T: If target player controls a creature with Infect, sacrifice your soul, then search your library for any number of spells and cast them without paying their mana costs.(*You lose the match, but at least you destroyed Phyrexia. Unless they play Stifle. In which case you sacrificed your soul for nothing. But you're Urza so you don't care. It's Phyrexia. THEY MUST DIE FOR WHAT THEY MADE YOU DO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!*)  
1/1  
  
Bang. Makes Ornithopter and Memnite cry in their obsoleteness. Probably the most broken creature type that can still make any flavor sense. xD
